author: dtpt
title: Voting & ID - ANONYMOUS Enabled
description: Voto Descentralizado com Identificação Total Voto Anônimo, com Uma Pessoa igual a Um Voto é necessário e uma exigência de $DTPT.

f6_assessments.q0: What is $DTPT ? You shouldn't expect voters (or community advisors) to know this or to read the whitepaper. It becomes difficult to understand the problem statement when this is not introduced early in the proposal.  The idea of having a blockchain of 1 person = 1 vote, rather 1 token = 1 vote is interesting as is the idea of using Cardano's voting capability  o achieve this in your own platform. Although this aligns with challenge i don't think it will bring much value to the ADA community as the $DTPT project is not well known or developed.
f6_assessments.q1: As the creator of the DTPT token it's clear that the proposer will have some experience with Cardano, but besides this not much is known of the experience of the proposer and that of the team. Some goals are presented but there's no plan on how they will be achieved, nor a timetable. This proposal presents some serious technical challenges (i.e. creating a new voting system based on Cardano' system) but there's no details on any technical aspects. This really reads more like a concept rather then a executable proposal.
f6_assessments.q2: There is no clear roadmap or milestones presented nor any KPI's or metrics of success. Stating "No guarantee of Success but there is GUARANTEE of Hard Work to Enable These Functions" is really not re-assuring. Relevant metric could be Increase of number of DTPT wallets/holders or number of votes cast using the new voting system. As is it would be very difficult for the community to audit the progress of this proposal.

f6_assessments.q0: Using Atala Prism to enable Decentralized Voting is definitely in line with this challenge
f6_assessments.q1: You have expressed your experience in running websites and cardano nodes. It would be helpful with future proposals if you could detail the experience of the 2 to 3 persons working on this project and how their experience is relevant. Your 9 months to complete seems to be tied into or dependent on another proposal hope you can better define that relationship. It would also be helpful if you could breakdown your budget. Will it all be spent on time?
f6_assessments.q2: Your auditability statement describes how to audit this proposal after completion but does does not demonstrate how to audit during the building process. If would be helpful to breakdown your processes and budget expenditures. If you do not receive funding in this fund I hope you can be more detailed in future proposals.

f6_assessments.q0: It is a great idea to think of as is 2021 and starting to implement a small part of provided Whitepaper with better details of how-to/flowcharts and should target Western countries like the US first. This project is not possible, at least in this decade, to be applicable for China, Russia, or any Middle East states. It is better to convince the CA (in the case of Project Catalyst) and Private Investor on how the current Cardano ecosystem can be a road or pathway for your project to run on it. Foreseeable future, I believe if the project can access any type of funding capital, then focus on re-shaping the Whitepaper and listing implementable for which targets/states/jurisdictions.
f6_assessments.q1:
Fundable project? Possible, yes; however, your project would face sustainability in the long run with the following example retrieved from provided Whitepaper. 

a) "Example: Instead of Arrest for Driving While Intoxicated, police will be required to act as a taxi to the person's home. Physical harm to other parties will be handled civilly. Other citizens will be allowed to assist without police interference." - page 11 of Whitepaper. By the reading of that, it already makes no sense. To make sense for the reader/CA should enclose how the constitution will be changed to carking this crypto-civilisation approach, for instance.

b) Whitepaper page 25: "Voting cannot be determined by how much money you have.". It is not entirely correct. For example, with ransomware as service (RASS) and with USD 45, there is a purchasable RAAS package – can run on Windows 10/Mac/Android-based, an easy delivery to target computers by email or built-for-purpose websites, say 100 union members network and looking from 10% of those targeted computers, smartphone devices infected. This is achievable. What may be happened next: can be remote voting? Self KYC can be generated without the actual owner acknowledgment? etc. 

c) Whitepaper page 41: "STOP LIFETIME IMPRISONMENT FOR NON-VIOLENT CRIMES:" idea is perfectly fit for purpose but need to cover the large percentage of other deadly non-violent crimes such as online bully, or social trial.

As mentioned in impact, the scope of impact is a massive scale on human liberty and should address some fundamentals from project strategy before calling for funding.
f6_assessments.q2: There is not much information on how Project Catalyst and the community will see/monitor the project progress once it gets funded and the human resource factor for the project to be listed.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal appears entirely unrelated the challenge brief. In fact, they make it clear that they aren't interested in adding value in the Cardano ecosystem or working within or improving Project Catalyst. Completely ignoring the pros and cons of the project the proposal authors have outlined, it would be a terrible return on intention to fund this proposal with the Cardano Treasury, as it doesn't seek to benefit the Cardano ecosystem.
f6_assessments.q1: Given that the proposal is unrelated to any aspect of the challenge brief and in fact states "We will not be part of the Cardano Catalyst Voting….We will implement our own voting system for the equality of all. There will be no compromises on that." I don't think it is a good use of my time as a CA to assess the feasibility of their project. I will simply say that the funding requested is completely unreasonable as they are not seeking to build or promote anything that would improve the Cardano ecosystem.
f6_assessments.q2: As the project does not define any particular problem within the challenge brief or within the Cardano ecosystem, there is no way to define the success of the project. And there is no way to audit the success.
